I am a postdoctoral researcher at the [Speech and Audio Processing Laboratory](http://sap.ist.i.kyoto-u.ac.jp/EN/) at [Kyoto University](https://www.kyoto-u.ac.jp/en) working with [Prof. Dr. Tatsuya Kawahara](http://sap.ist.i.kyoto-u.ac.jp/members/kawahara/). My work investigates **spoken dialogue systems** for **human-robot interaction** and **virtual agents**. I focus on experimental design, data collection, statistical analyses, coding, data visualization, and the promotion of reproducible research practices.

<!-- My interests are in phonetics, speech synthesis, and memory. -->

Previously I was a PhD researcher for the [PINTS project](http://pauseparticles.org/) which focused on pause-internal phonetic particles in speech communication. I examined the influence of **pause particles in speech synthesis**. My supervisors were [Prof. Dr. Bernd Möbius](https://www.coli.uni-saarland.de/~moebius/mywww/index.html) and [Dr. Jürgen Trouvain](https://www.coli.uni-saarland.de/~trouvain/) from the [Language Science and Technology](https://www.lst.uni-saarland.de/) department at [Saarland University](https://www.uni-saarland.de/start.html), Saarbrücken, Germany.
